item.description:
An event for Minilympic teams only. Please do not RSVP unless you are registered in the Minilympics roster.

This event will be an elimination style tournament. Each round, player(s) with the lowest score will be eliminated until we have a winner or winners.

This event is worth 20 points for 1st place, 15 points for 2nd place and 10 points for 3rd place. All teams will receive 5 points for participating.

 

The Game: The people have spoken. Monopoly Deal received the second most votes in the Player's Choice poll.

Monopoly the board game is an interesting beast.  Commonly found in almost every American home, the game was a titan in getting families to game together.  Later on, it became the catalyst for the Euro game craze as modern game groups formed in the hopes of avoiding this kind of game altogether (perhaps fitting that tonight's event falls on Friday the 13th).  Yet still the franchise remains popular.  Monopoly Deal is nothing like the board game however, as it fixes a critical flaw: nobody can ever truly dominate.  The closer you get to winning, the more vulnerable you become thus the game becomes a calculated affair of flying under the radar and delaying victory until the last possible second.

Tournament will run from 6pm to 10pm for 12 players.  If you wish to participate as a spectator, please say so in the comments and we will have room on a first come, first serve basis for 4 people.

 

*** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** ***
Did you know? (A Tribute to Gaming around the World):

The first board game in historical record is Ur, a race-to-the-finish game very similar to backgammon.  It was thought to be invented 4000-7000 years ago in Mesopotamia, in an area we would now know as Iran.
*** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** ***

group.name: The Salem Board Games Meetup Group

item.name: Minilympics: Player's Choice: Monopoly Deal
